metadata.title: RHSA-2017:0530: rabbitmq-server security and bug fix update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
RabbitMQ is an implementation of AMQP, the emerging standard for high performance enterprise messaging. The RabbitMQ server is a robust and scalable implementation of an AMQP broker.

Security Fix(es):

* A resource-consumption flaw was found in RabbitMQ Server, where the lengths_age or lengths_incr parameters were not validated in the management plugin. Remote, authenticated users with certain privileges could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service by passing values which were too large. (CVE-2015-8786)

bugzilla.text: CVE-2015-8786 rabbitmq-server: DoS via lengths_age or lengths_incr parameter in the management plugin

platform: Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 7.0 (Kilo) for RHEL 7

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
rabbitmq-server is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
